commands.heading: What is CSS?
commands.description: CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is a language used to describe the presentation of a document written in HTML or XML.

commands.heading: Why Use CSS?
commands.description: CSS allows you to separate content from design, making it easier to maintain and update websites.

commands.heading: Element Selector
commands.description: Selects all elements of a given type.

commands.heading: Class Selector
commands.description: Selects elements with a specific class attribute.

commands.heading: ID Selector
commands.description: Selects a single element with a specific ID attribute.

commands.heading: Attribute Selector
commands.description: Selects elements with a specific attribute or attribute value.

commands.heading: Group Selector
commands.description: Applies the same styles to multiple selectors.

commands.heading: Content
commands.description: The actual content of the element, such as text, an image, or other media.

commands.heading: Padding
commands.description: The space between the content and the border of the element.

commands.heading: Border
commands.description: A border that surrounds the padding (if any) and content.

commands.heading: Margin
commands.description: The space outside the border, between the border and other elements.
